title: Refine detail pane information display
description:
Enhance the detail pane to show more comprehensive issue information:
- Issue title with styling
- ID and status
- Blocker information with links
- Full description with proper formatting
- Dependencies list (blocks, related, parent-child)
- Dependents list (what this issue blocks)
- Created/updated timestamps
- Assignee information
- Labels if present
- Consider adding syntax highlighting for code in descriptions

title: Define initial requirements for abacus TUI
description:
Abacus is a terminal UI application for viewing beads issues in a tree structure. Initial features include:
- Display issues in hierarchical tree view based on parent-child relationships
- Show issue status with visual indicators (in_progress ðŸ”¥, closed âœ”, blocked â›”, ready â—‹)
- Navigate with keyboard (j/k or arrows)
- Expand/collapse issue trees
- Filter/search issues with /
- Jump to blockers with 'b'
- Toggle details pane with enter
- Built with bubbletea TUI framework and lipgloss for styling
- Reads data from 'bd list --json' command

title: Define requirements for automatic refresh
description:
Define how abacus should handle automatic refresh of beads data:
- Auto-refresh when .beads/ database file changes (file watcher)
- Manual refresh with keyboard shortcut (e.g., 'r' key)
- Preserve current cursor position and expanded state after refresh
- Show loading indicator during refresh
- Handle errors gracefully (e.g., if bd command fails)
- Consider refresh interval options (disabled, 1s, 5s, 10s, etc.)
- Maintain filter/search state across refreshes

title: Test multi-level hierarchy display
description: Create test issues to verify that the tree view correctly displays multiple levels of parent-child relationships and handles deep nesting gracefully.
